posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.44 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Mainly background work, hopefully improved networking experiences (again)

Complete list of new commits since 7.43.1:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.43.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.43 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.44.0 (154800)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

64 new commits since 7.43.1:

Show commits

  • Fix skipping subsequent call links. [1]

  • Limit delete archived media requests to 1000 items at a time. [2]

    Fixes an error that occurs when attempting to delete all archived media caused by exceeding the API's 1000 item limit.

  • Remove unused code. [3]

  • Add copy media backup id to backup playground. [4]

  • Update editorconfig with new ktlint rules. [5]

  • Fix clear filter position. [6]

  • Add new sticker pack preview screen. [7]

    Adds a new jetpack compose and kotlin implementation of the sticker pack preview screen, which will soon replace StickerPackPreviewActivity.java and StickerPackPreviewViewModel.java.

  • Fix missing avatars in notifications. [8]

  • Convert InternalConversationSettings to compose. [9]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.52.3 [10]

  • Fix validation errors around bad e164s in SSE's and merge events. [11]

  • Launch checkout flow on renew press. [12]

  • Fix possible crash in conversation activity. [13]

  • Fix backtrack symbol to change from ic_arrow_left_24 to symbol_arrow_start_24. [14]

  • Fix scheduled message logo from Signal logo to Calendar logo. [15]

  • Perform backup deletion in a durable job. [16]

  • Fix crash in storage sync validation. [17]

  • Re-run the e164 formatting application migration. [18]

  • Attempt to fix reproducible build issue caused by EditProxyFragment. [19]

  • Allow badge to update in toolbar when user changes their featured badge. [20]

  • Cache product pricing for 24hrs. [21]

  • Only fetch profiles if we haven't fetched them in the last five minutes. [22]

  • Fix various archive related attachment bugs. [23]

  • Silence noisy double stack trace when a LibSignalChatConnection connect() is canceled. [24]

  • Remove Media tab from backup playground. [25]

  • Fix rendering after rotation. [26]

  • Fix advanced pin settings routing. [27]

  • Add more backup cancellation checks. [28]

  • Exclude remote megaphones from local backups. [29]

  • Move profile fetches to ProfileApi. [30]

  • Improve handling of missing camera during calls. [31]

  • Update to latest backup protos; Bump to libsignal v0.73.1 [32]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.73.2; revert ProGuard workaround. [33]

  • Polish deletion UX. [34]

  • Add rememberRecipientField composable function for reading live recipient fields. [35]

  • Add ability to save remote backup key to device password manager. [36]

  • Fix audio duck due to MP4 gif. [37]

  • Backup delete resub flow state fix. [38]

  • Add skip dialog for during deletion. [39]

  • Increase WebSocket idle delayed disconnect timings. [40]

  • Do not send app level keep-alives for unauth WebSocket. [41]

  • When we move to awaiting download state, display dialog. [42]

  • Fix spelling error. [43]

  • Add restore type check and download specific messaging. [44]

  • Various UI polish items for backups. [45]

  • Ensure connection status logs are kept for monitoring in debug logs. [46]

  • Add additional method tracing. [47]

  • Polish backup type selection UI. [48]

  • Update missing password manager dialog copy. [49]

    Updates the copy of the dialog that shows when attempting to save a backup key, but there is no credential manager configured on the device that supports saving passwords.

  • Fix select all count in conversation list to be accurate. [50]

  • Fix action mode to use our own action mode toolbar instead of the built in androidx one. [51]

  • Check network tier on export. [52]

  • Rework billing client integration. [53]

  • Fix instrumentation tests for message backups checkout flow. [54]

  • Make .tool-versions more specific. [55]

  • Fix cut off string in stories. [56]

  • Add notification profiles to storage service. [57]

  • Use dynamic quality and webp for archive thumbnail generation. [58]

  • Add internal backup stats tab. [59]

  • Display resume over cellular only if awaiting wifi. [60]

  • Fix chat folder to not show mute option if there isn't any chat. [61]

  • Update translations and other static files. [62]

  • Update baseline profile. [63]

  • Bump version to 7.44.0 [64]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.43.1…v7.44.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

At least 67 languages changed since 7.43.1:

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from “Updated language translations” and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.43.1 so far here.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Tried sending 5 ~20MB .mp4 videos in quick succession and the main thread got blocked.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.44.0/9657ce012440292cfa09e0edb2481317d2cffc2c2f09e46ad93b08b592ec3b25

My phone also got reeeaally warm, as if the CPU was put to extreme encoding stress lol. I had to force close and reopen it. Logs are after I reopened the app

posts.cooked:

Tried sending 5 ~20MB .mp4 videos in quick succession and the main thread got blocked.

Wrong Link to Phone Contact in view Profile. All link to the same phone contact.

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.44.0/68da7678d450da9b40266c53695d15252b1a1bf6e3837c725d6909c501061bdd

During sending video flow:
Playback stops when entering text into text box
I’d expect playback to continue if I’ve manually started it, even when entering text

New Version: 7.44.1 (154900)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

4 new commits since 7.44.0:

  • Refactor LibSignalChatConnection to use an explicit queue sendRequest handling while CONNECTING. [1]

  • Update translations and other static files. [2]

  • Update baseline profile. [3]

  • Bump version to 7.44.1 [4]

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
got a message six hours after it was sent.

Screenshot_20250606-231217_Signal719×185 30.2 KB

timestamp: 1749223147707
debug: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.44.0/e5023f1206eed8b2ac447b3259cdc627b58db7dfeff629e93abd950e9235c9b0

posts.name: Kaartic Sivaraam
posts.cooked:
Signal is failing to start for me since today. I’m using v7.44.1. I’m unable to get the debug logs as the app doesn’t open. Once I tried to clear the app data and login and it opened fine. I had not restored the backup at that point.

When I try again with the backup restored, the app fails to start again. Kindly help me with this.

Also, the last backup seems to be on the month January. Did we drop the backup feature after that?

sivaraam:

Did we drop the backup feature after that?

Nope, the last one on my device was created today. Maybe your device doesn’t have sufficient space to store several backups?

Also, have you tried to grab logs using ADB?

posts.name: Kaartic Sivaraam
posts.cooked:
PiCob:

Nope, the last one on my device was created today. Maybe your device doesn’t have sufficient space to store several backups?

Storage shouldnt’t be an issue. There is ample space for more than dozens of backups. So, two of them could easily be stored. No idea why the backups got paused. I guess I’ve now lost the messages between Jan and Jun

PiCob:

Also, have you tried to grab logs using ADB?

That’s a good idea. I tried to do that and got the logs but couldn’t make much out of it. I’ve uploaded them. Here’s the link to it.

I had a notification for messages in a group. Then a new message was received and I saw the notification vanish. I did not dismiss it. In Android’s notification history it is listed under recently dismissed. Further messages in the group caused the notification to appear normally again.

Timestamp of the message that is shown in the “recently dismissed” entry in the history: 1749412897991

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.44.1/92531ebf0b4d02b004dbcd08a4ccd9bb4b8568a90c42e3115d6adbf2eeef13db

Screenshot of history

Screenshot_20250608-2209271080×682 47.2 KB

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
rassilon1963:

got a message six hours after it was sent.

Do you know that the other person actually successfully sent it 6 hours ago? The logs hint at it being a sender delay, logs from them if possible may help but the message may have aged off by now.

sivaraam:

When I try again with the backup restored, the app fails to start again. Kindly help me with this.

sivaraam:

I tried to do that and got the logs but couldn’t make much out of it.

Thanks, we’ll look into it.

FluffyPotato:

I had a notification for messages in a group. Then a new message was received and I saw the notification vanish. I did not dismiss it. In Android’s notification history it is listed under recently dismissed. Further messages in the group caused the notification to appear normally again.

Oh, now this is curious. Thanks for the keen observation, we’re looking into it.

cody-signal:
FluffyPotato:

I had a notification for messages in a group. Then a new message was received and I saw the notification vanish. I did not dismiss it. In Android’s notification history it is listed under recently dismissed. Further messages in the group caused the notification to appear normally again.

Oh, now this is curious. Thanks for the keen observation, we’re looking into it.

I had this same thing happen in a 1:1 chat, but there’s probably no debug log now.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
cody-signal:

Do you know that the other person actually successfully sent it 6 hours ago? The logs hint at it being a sender delay, logs from them if possible may help but the message may have aged off by now.

i doubt they know and it’ll probably be hard to get logs from them, sorry

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked: I got a MTE crash with the latest beta - logs available here: Wormhole - Simple, private file sharing

New Version: 7.44.2 (155000)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

  • Ignore non-existing recipients in notification profiles storage sync. [1]

  • Fix possible crash in story send. [2]

  • Update translations and other static files. [3]

  • Bump version to 7.44.2 [4]

posts.cooked: Just noticed that story indicator (circle around profile picture) does not exist anymore in chat list. Indicator is shown in chat. Can somebody confirm? @Aku-Stable

Janerio:

Can somebody confirm? @Aku-Stable

None of my contacts post stories on Signal, so I wouldn’t be able to check this.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked:
seems that messages that contain both audio and text (by attaching an audio file as a file and adding a caption) are not editable.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.44.1/1ab63176fdda83e4d81929a4fa7801824101eb5a2ecf179d54054fd8631f821e
edit: and when you edit them from desktop, the edits don’t propagate to mobile.
